question: Can I increase my mortgage loan amount if my annual income increases to $80,000?
true_answer: Yes, with an increased income, you may be eligible to increase your mortgage amount, provided your DTI and credit score remain favorable.

steps.content: Can I increase my mortgage loan amount if my annual income increases to $80,000?

Plan: 1) Hand off to home_loan_agent to evaluate increased loan eligibility. 2) Check with credit_agent to ensure credit score remains suitable. 3) Use calculator for updated DTI. 4) Supervisor review. 5) Provide final answer.
Retrieving knowledge on how increased income affects mortgage eligibility.
Increased income can lead to eligibility for a larger loan amount if other criteria like credit score and DTI are favorable.
Verifying credit score remains stable or improved.
Credit score check: Credit score remains stable and favorable.
Calculating new debt-to-income ratio with increased income.
New DTI is calculated as 28%, which is below the maximum threshold.
Would a larger down payment help as well?
Retrieving knowledge on the impact of larger down payments.
A larger down payment can reduce the loan-to-value ratio, making the loan terms more favorable.
Review complete, all checks indicate increased eligibility.
Yes, with an increased income, you may be eligible to increase your mortgage amount, provided your DTI and credit score remain favorable. A larger down payment can also be beneficial.
